roleset.name: support for a position
roleset.note: ENDORSEMENT-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to 'endorse.01'. No Vn class. Framed by Katie. (from endorsement.01-n)

example.name: passive
example.text: [That offer]-1 was endorsed *trace*-1 by the shareholders committee .

example.name: active
example.text: The state has endorsed the New England Electric plan, which promises to limit rate increases to 4.8% annually for seven years.
example.arg: the New England Electric plan , which promises to limit rate increases to 4.8 % annually for seven years

example.name: all args
example.text: John endorsed Richard Nixon for president.

example.name: Args 0 and 1
example.text: your strong endorsement to repeal this Depression-era fossil

example.name: Another arg 0 and 1
example.text: their formal endorsement of a merger with Daimler-Benz AG
example.arg: of a merger with Daimler-Benz AG

example.name: Slightly different form of arg 1
example.text: formal endorsement to Russia's white, red, and blue flag
example.arg: to Russia's white, red, and blue flag

example.name: The rare arg 2
example.text: Ehud Barak won the endorsement of his Labor Party as its candidate for Prime Minister
example.arg: as its candidate for Prime Minister

roleset.name: sign on the backside
roleset.note: ENDORSE-V NOTES: Both these senses reduce to 'be on/at the back;' 'dorse' = 'back.' (from endorse.02-v)

example.name: typical
example.text: John endorsed his paycheck before depositing it.
